Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students which will include (but not be limited to) student name student ID admission date classes credits GPA and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.': Functional
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical labs which will include (but not be limited to) class name class number lab section listing of students enrolled instructor day(s) time and location.': Functional
'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier program of study preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.': Functional
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort.': Functional
'The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.': Operational
'The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that’s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface': Look and Feel
'For each class within a sequence for a cohort Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.': Functional
'For each class within a sequence for a cohort Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.': Functional
'A cohort shall be associated to one Program of Study offered by the department.': Functional
'The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system including (but not limited to) staff members students lecture instructors clinical lab instructors and clinical site administrators.': Functional
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.': Functional
'The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation 98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.': Usability
'The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered number of sections needed number of labs needed and room types needed.': Functional
'The product shall ensure that the database’s data corresponds to the data entered by the user. Each conference room reservation in the system will contain the same information as was entered by the user.': Security
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional
'The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table.': Functional
'The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort’s program of study and changes to a given week’s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).': Functional
'The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.': Usability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts which will include the students enlisted the Program of study sequence of classes cohort progress through the program and timeline of completion.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

'The product shall simulate the look of ships at sea.': Look and Feel
'When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall notify the players that the ship was sunk.': Functional
'When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall indicate the type of ship sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.': Functional
'When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.': Functional
'When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the offensive grid of the offensive player.': Functional
'When a shot is marked as a hit the product shall simulate the sound of a shot hitting its target.': Look and Feel
'The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player’s ships which had not been previously marked as sunk.': Functional
'For estimators the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.': Operational

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'When a ship is sunk the product shall simulate the sound of a sinking ship.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall interface with the faculty central server.'

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'A database management system such as Oracle DB2 MySql or HSQL will need to be integrated with the product.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be able to process 10 000 transactions per hour within two years of its launch. This number will increase to 20 000 by Release 2.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product must work with most database management systems (DBMS) on the market whether the DBMS is colocated with the product on the same machine or is located on a different machine on the computer network.': Operational
'The product is expected to integrate with multiple database management systems. The product will operate with Oracle SQL Server DB2 MySQL HSQL and MS Access.': Operational

'98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum software requirements prior to implementation: Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0. Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1. Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls': Operational
'The System shall maintain consistent security. Any changes in user passwords and/or permissions should take affect in all parts of the System.': Security

'Product installations and upgrades shall be handled by the middleware technology team within established launch time frames.': Operational

'For estimators the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.': Operational

'The website should have an African feel but should not alienate non-Africans. The website should use animation on pages which are describing the services to grab the users attention and encourage them to sign up.': Look and Feel

'The product shall display the grids within a circle as a view from a periscope.': Look and Feel

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product must be able to interface with various database management systems. The product shall communicate successfully with the database management system on 100% of all transactions.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Website shall request and authorize credit card payment before allowing a user to stream a movie.': Functional
'Movies can only be streamed if the customer has purchased a movie and is within the 2-day time period to stream the movie.': Functional

'The streaming server will support a maximum of 700 movies; new servers can be added to support more movies.': Scalability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product must comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities. 95% of the product look & feel will be approved by the Architecture group prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'No lead evaluation will complete in a time period longer than 25 seconds for 97% of all leads processed.': Performance
'The process must fit within the processing time conditions set forth by the Auto Rep Assignment process in which a lead is assigned within 3 minutes of the total life cycle.': Performance
'The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.': Availability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall display data from the Sync Matrix 1.0 and Exercise Management Tool 1.0 applications'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The language of the product shall accommodate all of the target market countries. 90% of survey respondents from each target market country will find that the language of the product is acceptable.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'The system shall display Events in a vertical table by time.': Functional
'The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.': Availability
The interface shall be appealing to callers and supervisors. In the interface and usability survey 80% of beta testers must report that the interface is appealing.': Look and Feel
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional
'Each time a conference room is reserved the conference room schedule shall be updated to reflect the time and date of the reservation.': Functional
'PME Subsystem shall allow for a product to exist in more than one submenu': Functional
'The WCS system shall have the ability to include data for regions outside the United States and be accessed by users outside of the United States if approved by CCR management.': Scalability
'The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.': Availability
'The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.': Performance
'The system shall update or create new property listings in the MLS': Functional
'The System shall allow for a minimum of 6 users to work at the same time.': Performance
'A clinical class shall specify the course name lecture room requirements clinical site needs lecture instructor needs and clinical lab instructor needs.': Functional

'The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria': Functional
'The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.': Functional
'The process must fit within the processing time conditions set forth by the Auto Rep Assignment process in which a lead is assigned within 3 minutes of the total life cycle.': Performance

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The verbiage used within the system shall be consistent with Standard English and the terminology of the national Nursing Community.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall update existing conference rooms.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'A new user shall be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page.': Usability

'The product shall have an intuitive user interface.': Functional
'The product shall be installed by an untrained realtor without recourse to separately-printed instructions.': Usability
'The product shall record different meeting types.': Functional
The interface shall be appealing to callers and supervisors. In the interface and usability survey 80% of beta testers must report that the interface is appealing.': Look and Feel
'The product shall be available 24 hours per day seven days per week.': Availability
'The system shall allow a user to define the time segments': Functional
'The website shall be attractive to all audiences. The website shall appear to be fun and the colors should be bright and vibrant.': Look and Feel
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional

'The product shall interface with the Choice Parts System. This provides the feed of recycled parts data.': Operational

'The product shall generate a CMA report in an acceptable time.': Performance

'The product will be available for licensing as a one-server two-five servers or five-or-more servers license.': Operational

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be easy to use. 90% of users will be able to successfully reserve a conference room within 5 minutes of product use.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Every registered user will have access to the product’s support site via the Internet. 70% of registered users shall find a solution to their problem within 5 minutes of using the support site.': Usability
'The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. : 90% of new users shall be able to start the display of Events or Activities within 90 minutes of using the product.': Usability
'The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.': Usability
'The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.': Operational
'The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system including (but not limited to) staff members students lecture instructors clinical lab instructors and clinical site administrators.': Functional
'The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation 98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.': Usability
'The product shall give users feedback when necessary. 80% of the users surveyed report that the product accurately confirms their actions.': Usability
'The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. Nine out ten users shall be able to successfully complete a game with no training.': Usability
'The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.': Availability
'The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard': Usability
'The product shall ensure that only company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs may have product access. 100% of all logons shall be by either company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs.': Security
'The product shall be easy to use by Adjusters and Collision Estimators. 95% of Adjusters and Collision Estimators shall find the product easy to use.': Usability
'The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.': Usability
'The product shall ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized users. The product will be able to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts': Security
The system shall be easy to learn by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors shall learn how to use the system within 10 minutes.': Usability
'The system shall use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by the user community.': Usability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product should be able to be used by 90% of novice users on the Internet.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'All customer information will be stored on a secure database accessible only to authorized personnel.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

'The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered number of sections needed number of labs needed and room types needed.': Functional

'Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.': Functional
'The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.': Operational
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System.': Functional
'Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department into the system.': Functional
'The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.': Functional
'The product shall ensure that the database’s data corresponds to the data entered by the user. Each conference room reservation in the system will contain the same information as was entered by the user.': Security
'The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort’s program of study and changes to a given week’s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).': Functional
'Classes for a given cohort shall not conflict with regards to the time and day that they are offered.': Functional

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort’s Program of Study.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can advertise empty time slots.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members’ planning purposes.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall make the users want to use it. 80% of the users surveyed report they are regularly using the product after the first 2 weeks post-launch.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

'The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.': Availability
'The product shall synchronize with the office system every hour.': Performance

'The product shall have the ability to receive automatic software updates as new threats emerge. 100% of customers will be able to receive automatic software updates transmitted to the installed product.': Security

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall display Events or Activities.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall have a consistent color scheme and fonts.'

The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The search for the preferred repair facility shall take no longer than 8 seconds. The preferred repair facility is returned within 8 seconds'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

'The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.': Operational
'The product shall allow a player to end a game at any time during the game.': Functional
'The system shall be built such that it is as secure as possible from malicious interference.': Security
'The product must be able to interface with any HTML browser. The product shall transmit data between the user and the product without problems. The product shall display HTML properly in 80% of all HTML browsers tested (minimum is to test 8 browsers).': Operational
'The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory. : 90% of new users shall be able to start the display of Events or Activities within 90 minutes of using the product.': Usability
'The application shall ask the user to confirm dropping a player or trading a player before performing the action.': Usability
'If projected the data must be understandable. On a 10x10 projection screen 90% of viewers must be able to determine that Events or Activities are occuring in current time from a viewing distance of 100': Usability
'The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard': Usability
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional
'For estimators the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.': Operational
'The system shall provide charts for the Activity or Event actual versus assumed time.': Functional
'The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall remain operational as a result of the input of malicious data. The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall not crash 100% of the time that malicious data is input into the product.': Fault Tolerance
'Any interface between a user and the automated system shall have a maximum response time of 5 seconds unless noted by an exception below.': Performance
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional
'For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process a case activity will be generated. Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.': Functional
'The product shall give users feedback when necessary. 80% of the users surveyed report that the product accurately confirms their actions.': Usability
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional
'The product shall have the ability to receive automatic software updates as new threats emerge. 100% of customers will be able to receive automatic software updates transmitted to the installed product.': Security
'The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.': Functional
'The product shall maintain a list of players.': Functional
'The product shall ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized users. The product will be able to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts': Security
'The system shall offer a display of all the Events in the exercise.': Functional
'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional
'The product shall ensure that the database’s data corresponds to the data entered by the user. Each conference room reservation in the system will contain the same information as was entered by the user.': Security
'The product shall be robust.The product shall have fault avoidance based on standards adoption.': Fault Tolerance
'The product must make use of web/application server technology. Open source examples include Apache web server Tomcat and the JBoss application server.': Operational

'Users shall be able to reach the ‘add’ ‘drop’ and ‘trade player’ pages with one click from the team owner’s page.': Usability

'The product shall have a customizable Look and Feel.': Functional
'The product shall allow a user to remove himself or herself from the list of players at any time.': Functional
'If a lead is scored to the high range the system will supply the lead data and score to the enterprise system.': Functional

'The product will be available for licensing as a one-server two-five servers or five-or-more servers license.': Operational
'The product shall increase productivity of Collision Estimators. 80% of the Collision Estimators shall agree their productivity has increase within 1 month of using the product.': Usability

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'When the offensive player takes a shot the product shall simulate the sound of a ship at sea.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'When a game is ended the product shall notify the players that the game is ended.': Functional
'The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player’s ships which had not been previously marked as sunk.': Functional
'The product shall allow a player to end a game at any time during the game.': Functional
'When a game is ended the product shall allow each player to identify himself or herself as an available player in the list of players.': Functional
'At the start of each turn the product shall notify each player of his or her status.': Functional
'Once a game has been initiated the product shall make the players assigned to the game unavailable for selection from the list of players.': Functional
'The product shall allow a player to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players.': Functional
'The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort’s program of study and changes to a given week’s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).': Functional
'The product shall be able to send meeting notifications via different kinds of end-user specified methods.': Functional

'The system will notify affected parties for routine communication purposes including but not limited to informing students of upcoming offered classes (timeline) and what their schedule will be/shall be.': Functional
'When the hit results in sinking a ship the product shall notify the players that the ship was sunk.': Functional

A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information; the dispute case number the type of chargeback requested (pending or immediate) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional

'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall able to operate within a business office environment typical of the Nursing Department at DePaul University.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall offer the ability to pause and resume the refresh of data.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'Only registered customers can purchase streaming movies.': Functional
'Only registered customers can purchase streaming movies.': Security

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The owner shall have free access to all of the streaming movies.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall retain user preferences in the event of a failure.': Fault Tolerance
'The product’s Look and Feel shall be able to incorporate aspects of the customer’s organization such as logo branding and identity': Look and Feel
'The product shall maintain a list of players.': Functional

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall retain the customer’s buying preferences and information.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall provide Portals.The product shall help System Administrators to analyze the transactions with ad-hoc reporting and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product must be highly configurable for use with various database management systems for the end users. 80% of end users are able to integrate new database management systems with the product without changing the product’s software code.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information; the dispute case number the type of chargeback requested (pending or immediate) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional
'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.': Functional
'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system. A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional
'The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.': Functional
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional
'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number the type of retrieval requested (copy original or portfolio) and the date that the merchant response is due.': Functional
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System. This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant’s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.': Operational
'The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.': Functional
'The Disputes System must provide Search functionality. The search method must include the ability to search by (1) the dispute case number (2) the merchant account number (3) the cardmember account number and (4) the issuer number. In addition to the above criteria the search functionality must further allow the user to limit the results of the search by a date range the type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) the case status (open closed or all) and the dispute reason code.': Functional
'The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user’s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.': Security
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional
'The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365 with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows. Monday – Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST': Operational
'The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.': Functional
'The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.': Security
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application. This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.': Operational
'The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.': Operational
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Statement Database. The Statement Database provides the transaction details to the Disputes System. All transaction details must be obtained from the Statement Database': Operational
'The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.': Security
'100% of cardmember services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.': Usability
'The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Information Database. The Cardmember Information Database provides detailed information with regard to a cardmember. All cardmember detail information must be obtained from the Cardmember Information Database.': Operational
'The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.': Functional
'The Disputes System must prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.': Functional
'The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.': Functional
'A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user. The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list. For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.': Functional
'The product shall prevent the input of malicious data. The product and/or adjacent hardware/software systems’ data shall remain 100% uncorrupted each time malicious data is input into the product.': Security
'System shall allow users to update their billing and contact information via the “My Account” section of the website.': Functional
'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.': Functional
'For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process a case activity will be generated. Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.': Functional
'100% of the cardmember and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.': Usability
'The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.': Functional
'The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.': Functional
'The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.': Functional
'The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.': Security
'The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.': Look and Feel
'The product shall ensure that the database’s data corresponds to the data entered by the user. Each conference room reservation in the system will contain the same information as was entered by the user.': Security
'All authorized users once authenticated must be able to logon to the Disputes System': Security
'The product shall be robust with fault tolerance.The product shall have fault tolerance by using recovery technique compensatory transaction and routing around failures.': Fault Tolerance
'The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall remain operational as a result of the input of malicious data. The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall not crash 100% of the time that malicious data is input into the product.': Fault Tolerance
'The product shall create an exception log of problems encountered within the product for transmission to our company for analysis and resolution.': Fault Tolerance
'The system shall have basic data integrity checking to reduce the possibility of incorrect or invalid data being introduced.': Security
'New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end will be loaded into the RFS system prior to the budget start process.': Maintainability
'The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.': Operational
'All updates to data files or database must be initiated from the Disputes System.': Security
'The product shall ensure that only company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs may have product access. 100% of all logons shall be by either company employees or external users with company-approved user IDs.': Security
'The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system including (but not limited to) staff members students lecture instructors clinical lab instructors and clinical site administrators.': Functional
'The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort’s program of study and changes to a given week’s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).': Functional
'The product must be able to interface with any HTML browser. The product shall transmit data between the user and the product without problems. The product shall display HTML properly in 80% of all HTML browsers tested (minimum is to test 8 browsers).': Operational
'The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.': Functional
'The product shall ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized users. The product will be able to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts': Security
'The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table.': Functional
'The Disputes application shall ensure that only authorized users are allowed to logon to the application.': Security
'The list of dispute cases that are displayed after a search is performed must be color coded for easy identification of dispute cases based upon the dispute case status.': Usability
'The product shall provide Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition.The product shall support Transparent Resource addition and Dynamic Change support to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions of more than 1 day.': Performance
'The product shall be able to send meeting notifications via different kinds of end-user specified methods.': Functional
'Once a game has been initiated the product shall make the players assigned to the game unavailable for selection from the list of players.': Functional
'The product shall adhere to the corporate online availability schedule. The application is brought down only within 98% of the scheduled outages per the availability schedule.': Availability
'The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.': Operational
'The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students which will include (but not be limited to) student name student ID admission date classes credits GPA and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.': Functional
The product shall ensure that only supervisors can enter a caller’s schedule.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.': Security
'The application shall be able to complete every user transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network.': Performance
'The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.': Usability
'The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation 98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.': Usability

'The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.': Performance

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall be easy to learn by Adjusters and Collision Estimators. The product shall be learned with two days onsite training'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The System shall generate Inventory Quantity Adjustment document based on product daily sales data and product formulas.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall respond fast to keep up-to-date data in the display.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.': Look and Feel
'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction. The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.': Functional
'The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.': Security
'The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.': Functional
'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions. The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.': Functional
'The system shall use IBM and CCR branding standards. The interface must have one IBM logo and one CCR logo.': Look and Feel

A detailed history of the actions taken on the case including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.': Functional

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'All screens created as part of the Disputes application must comply with corporate standards for interface creation.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'When a shot is marked as a miss the product shall simulate the sound of a shot missing its target.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'Each page shall contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.': Functional

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'One insurance company shall not be able to view another insurance companys claim data.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product shall comply with corporate color scheme'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category:

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The search radius shall be between 1 and 30 miles'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The system shall be able to display a printable summary of the system log.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The website shall prevent its data from being corrupted when incorrect data is entered in.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall create an exception log of problems encountered within the product for transmission to our company for analysis and resolution.': Fault Tolerance
'The product shall achieve a 98% uptime. The product shall not fail more than 2% of the available online time.': Availability

'The product shall provide Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition.The product shall support Transparent Resource addition and Dynamic Change support to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions of more than 1 day.': Performance
'The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall remain operational as a result of the input of malicious data. The product and/or dependent databases/filesystems shall not crash 100% of the time that malicious data is input into the product.': Fault Tolerance
'The product shall adhere to the corporate online availability schedule. The application is brought down only within 98% of the scheduled outages per the availability schedule.': Availability
'The product shall prevent the input of malicious data. The product and/or adjacent hardware/software systems’ data shall remain 100% uncorrupted each time malicious data is input into the product.': Security

Now, classify the following given requirement: 'The product interface should be fast. The response time of the product interface should not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time. For 10% of the time the response time should not be more than 10 seconds.not be more than 10 seconds.'


Please classify the given software requirements into the following categories: Functional, Availability, Fault Tolerance, Legal, Look and Feel, Maintainability, Operational, Performance, Portability, Scalability, Security, Usability. The answer should be very concise and short, i.e. only one of the above-mentioned categories.
Below are some demonstration examples for you to learn, which consist of a software requirement and its category: 
'The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.': Availability
